ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5 hours
~5hrs
1 -2 hours doing the readings

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Interesting content, but not always presented in an engaging fashion. Presenting a different psychosocial concept each week seems like it would be interesting, but proved to be redundant. Most students in this course are not SBS students, so would be nice to see the material catered towards this population. For instance, if we discussed more current research or applied the concepts in a critical thinking manner, the lecture would be more engaging.I enjoyed listening to other students' prospectus presentations in section.
Less time consuming that the first semester SBS course
This course exceeded my expectations, I learned a lot more about psychosocial factors role on influencing health than I thought I would.
This course has different forms, and all of them are great.

Sort of boring topic. Didn't like to organization of the class. Student presentations weren't helpful and took too long of the class. Discussion sections weren't helpful either, lots of juvenile exercises and wasn't productive.
Great course. Perhaps limiting the student-led presentations to 20-30 minutes may be better.
Strengths: Encouraging class participation and discussion. Very clear expectations and professor's interest in students. Interesting subject matter, enjoyed the structure of the class.
interesting topics but discussion sessin too long
Strengths:1. Well crafted reading list2. Interesting course delivery3. Good assignment structureWeaknesses:Sections do not add much to lecture

I would have liked to see more integration of the different pieces of the course. It did not seem to build as the semester progressed, but rather each lecture seemed independent. Furthermore, the discussion sessions could have been better utilized to pull in the themes of the course.
Sections and classes were a bit redundant

This is a good epidemiology class. The topics covered are important, although they could have been discussed more deeply or rigorously. The structure of the class and the topics covered feel a bit redundant towards the end.
B
The format was difficult and the discussion sections were utterly pointless. The Prof was passionate you could tell wanted to make the class a good one though.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Dr. Rozanova is very passionate about psychosocial epidemiology, and this is apparent in her lecture. She is very interested in what students have to say about the concepts, and she very respectfully asks for our input and waits to hear our answers. Her voice can be very soothing, which can make it difficult to stay engaged. I encourage Dr. Rosanova to "spice up" her lecture a bit more. For instance, when she posts a picture and asks the class about their thoughts, this keeps students engaged and thinking.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Lectures can be a little dry. The student-led discussion and her lectures were very repetitive so I didn't think we needed to meet twice a week for this course.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Very organized and accessible to students. She really is passionate about the subject.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  She is great! Clear in checkpoint, and rich in resources.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Good instructor, just needs to restructure the class.

Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Professor Rozanova is well-versed in and passionate about psychosocial epidemiology. I think she would make a phenomenal teacher with a little more practice and a more-rigorous and more-demanding curriculum.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Very knowledgeable and approachable.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Interest in students and knowledge of subject matter was appreciated, good at sparking interesting class discussions.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  knowledgeble and kind

Instructor: Julia Rozanova  The instructor delivered the lecture thoughtfully, was always approachable for questions, and used a very interesting assignment cadence. Considering that most of the class took it as a requirement rather than genuine interest, Julia's performance is particular remarkable.

Instructor: Julia Rozanova  The instructor was knowledgeable and invested in the students' learning. I would like to have seen her push the class a little further in their thinking and discussion of the materialthough.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Very strong professor but could facilitate more engaging in-class discussions/learning

Instructor: Julia Rozanova  Professor Rozanova is a good instructor, who is clearly knowledgeable and cares about her discipline. Her powerpointsare informative, but could go even deeper into the material.
Instructor: Julia Rozanova  A-

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Roza Tammer. Roza is prepared for section is invested in providing a good learning environment for her students. I appreciate her willingness to help students and be flexible. I would like to see Roza speak in a more professional voice. The intonation in her voice can be distracting and not professional. This is a picky suggestion, but I think will be very helpful to Roza in her professional career.
Milena is a great TA! She provided a lot of great feedback and direction for our final paper.
Roza Tamer - great TA!
Roza Tammer is great!
Roza was a good TA, helpful.
Roza was awkward.
Milena was a phenomenal facilitator of discussion. I learned a lot from my time with her.
Milena did a great job!
Milena Gianfrancesco: Very friendly, upbeat, responsible and professonial. Great at providing useful feedback and sparking interesting class discussions.
engaged and responsible

The TA put effort in, however, since the section did not add much to the class it was difficult to engage the students. Generally, one might consider not offering the class. The material might simply not have enough substance for ~3 hours per week.
Milena Gianfrancesco - She was helpful, always offered helpful and timely feedback for all inquiries.
Milena and Roza were both excellent!
Milena held a great section. She fostered an environment in which everyone felt comfortable contributing, which is both important and rare in sections.

The TA's were not good. They were responsible for grading the majority of our work throughout the semester, which I find highly innaproriate considering that many of the students they were evaluating have more experience and knowledge than they did. Not good. They had far too much influence over our performance in the course.
Awful!

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is required for students, and I think is an okay course. I was really excited for the course, but ended up a bit disappointed.
I recommend taking this course (if SBS is not your concentration) than the first semester course.
I was glad I took this course as my SBS requirement.
Among SBS courses, choose this one will not disappoint you!
Boring. Wouldn't recommend it unless as a requirement.
Survey course of psychosocial epi
Yes, I would recommend it. It was unfortunate that many people stopped attending class sessions by the end of the term as more people in attendance would have improved later class discussions.
interesting class but expect some unnecessary work
The course is a good option for fulfilling the requirement.
This course was structured as an introduction to the various areas of psychosocial epidemiology research with an emphasis on methodologies.
I found it too epi-heavy and less practical for a management student.

This is a good epidemiology class. The topics covered are important, although they could have been discussed more deeply or rigorously. The structure of the class and the topics covered feel a bit redundant towards the end.
Its ok.
